com.raweng.built.userInterface

Class BuiltUISignUpController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.raweng.built.userInterface.BuiltUISignUpController

  • public abstract class BuiltUISignUpController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides SignUp functionality for Built.io Backend.
    Author:
    raw engineering, Inc
    Note :- Before using sign up, the user needs to set application key. 
     // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 setApplication(builtApplication);

    Example
     public class UserActivity extends BuiltUISignUpController

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      ImageView closeImageView
      Provides ImageView object which will be used to close BuiltUISignUpController activity.
      EditText emailEditText
      Provides EditText object which will be used for Email.
      ImageView logoImageView
      Provides ImageView object which will be used for default logo image.
      EditText passwordEditView
      Provides EditText object which will be used for Password.
      EditText retypePasswordEditView
      Provides EditText object which will be used for Retype Password.
      Button signUpButton
      Provides Button object which will be used for BuiltUISignUpController using BuiltUser method.
      RelativeLayout signupLogoRelativeLayout
      Provides RelativeLayout object, which will be used to show container of social info and social login buttons.
      LinearLayout signupMainLinearLayout
      Provides RelativeLayout object, which will be used to show container of closeview, logoview, email, password, forgetview and login button.
      ScrollView signupScrollview
      Provides RelativeLayout object, which will be used as main container.
      LinearLayout signupViewsLinearLayout
      Provides RelativeLayout object, which will be used to show container of social login buttons.
      EditText userNameEditText
      Provides EditText object which will be used for UserName.

    • Method Detail

      • setApplication

        public void setApplication(BuiltApplication application)
        Sets application key on this object.
        Parameters:
        application - instance. Note :- Before using sign up, the user needs to set application key.

        Example
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 setApplication(builtApplication);

      • setApplicationKey

        @Deprecated
public void setApplicationKey(java.lang.String applicationKey)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets application key on this object.
        Parameters:
        applicationKey - Application api Key of your application. Note :- Before using sign up, the user needs to set application key.

        Example
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 setApplicationKey("blt5d4sample2633b");

      • setLogoImage

        public void setLogoImage(int resId,
                ScaleType scaleType)
        Sets default logo image using the source id and image scale type.
        Parameters:
        resId - identifier of the resource.
        scaleType - options for scaling the bounds of an image to the bounds of view.

        Example
         setLogoImage(R.drawable.ic_built,ScaleType.CENTER);

      • setACL

        public void setACL(BuiltACL builtACL)
        Sets ACL on signing up user object.
        Parameters:
        builtACL - object of BuiltACL class.

        Example
         BuiltACL builtACL = new BuiltACL();
 builtACL.setPublicWriteAccess(true);

 setACL(builtACL);

      • setImageContentDescription

        public void setImageContentDescription(java.lang.String contentDescription)
        Sets the logo image description. Sets this property to enable better accessibility support for your application. This is especially true for views that do not have textual representation (For example, ImageView).
        Parameters:
        contentDescription - contentDescription.

        Example
         setImageContentDescription("content description");

      • setMargin

        public void setMargin(View view,
             int top,
             int bottom,
             int left,
             int right)
        Sets the margins for the provided view inside RelativeLayout. provide values in integer.
        Parameters:
        view - set view.
        top - set top Margin
        bottom - set bottom Margin
        left - set left Margin
        right - set right Margin

        Example
         setMargin(imageviewObject,100,100,100,100);
